Written maintenance procedures have been assembled.  Maintenance checks on process equipment are conducted and documented to ensure proper operations of the chlorination system.  Process equipment examined by these checks includes: pressure vessels, storage tanks, piping systems, relief and vent systems, emergency shutdown systems, controls, pumps, overhead cranes  and other chlorination related equipment.  Maintenance operations are carried out by qualified personnel with previous training in maintenance practices.  Personnel are offered specialized training as needed.  Equipment deficiencies identified by the maintenance checks are corrected in a safe and timely manner.

Written procedures are in place to manage changes in process chemicals, terminology, equipment and procedures.  The most recent review/revision of maintenance procedures was performed on May 8, 2014.  Process operators, maintenance personnel, or any other employee whose job tasks are affected by modifications in process conditions are promptly made aware of and offered training to deal with the modification.

Pre-startup safety reviews related to new processes and to modifications in established processes are conducted at Katy Addicks Surface Water Pump Plant.  These reviews are conducted to confirm that construction, equipment operating, and maintenance procedures are suitable for safe startup prior to placing equipment into operations.

Compliance audits are conducted on a regular basis to determine whether the provisions set out under the RMP rules and regulations are being implemented.  These audits are carried out at least every three years and any corrective actions required as a result are undertaken in a safe and prompt manner.

Executive Summary for the City of Houston Katy Addicks Surface Water Pump Station

The City of Houston owns and operates the Katy Addicks Surface Water Pump Plant located on the northwest side of Houston, Texas.  This water treatment plant uses chlorine to disinfect public drinking water to protect public health per state and federal water quality standards.  The Katy Addicks Surface Water Pump Plant uses and stores chlorine, a chemical subjected to the EPA's Risk Management Plan (RMP) program rules and regulations.  The maximum inventory of chlorine at the facility is 32,000 pounds (16 one ton containers). Chlorine containers and equipment, except the chlorine scrubber, are housed inside the chlorine building.

Katy Addicks Surface Water Pump Plant is strongly committed to employee, public and environmental safety.  This commitment is demonstrated by a comprehensive accidental release prevention program that covers areas such as design, installation, operating procedures, maintenance and employee training associated with the processes at its facility.  The design of the chlorination system supports the risk management programs goals and objectives.  New  equipment, processes and equipment are evaluated in our quest to improve safety and reduce or eliminate the use of chlorine at the plant.  No changes in process management are currently anticipated.  

During the last five years, there have been no accidental releases involving chlorine that resulted in any offsite impacts.  There have been no deaths, injuries, property or environmental damage, evacuations or sheltering in place.  

Employees, supervisors and managers are responsible for complying with the RMP regulations. It is policy to implement appropriate controls to prevent possible releases of regulated substances. In the event of a release, Drinking Water Operations has an assigned Chemical Spill Response Coordinator in addition to the City of Houston's Safety Department.

nt investigations are conducted for any incident that has resulted in, or could reasonably result in a release of the regulated substance.  These investigations are undertaken to identify the situation leading to the incident (root case analysis) as well as any corrective actions to prevent the release from reoccurring.  Incident investigations start promptly and no later than 48 hours after the event.  All reports are retained for a minimum five (5) years.

Katy Addicks Surface Water Pump Plant truly believes that process safety management and accident prevention is a team effort.  Employees are strongly encouraged to express their views concerning accident prevention issues and to recommend improvements.  In addition, employees have access to all information created as part of the facility's implementation of the RMP rule, including information resulting from process hazard analyses reviews.

Contractors may perform specialized maintenance and construction activities at the facility.  Prior to selecting a contractor, a thorough evaluation of safety performance of contractor is carried out.  Katy Addicks Surface Water Pump Plant has a strict policy of informing the contractors of known potential hazards related to the contractors' work and the processes.  Contractors are also informed of all the procedures for emergency response. 

Katy Addicks Surface Water Pump Plant has a written emergency response plan to deal with accidental releases of hazardous materials.  The plan includes all aspects of emergency response including adequate first aid and a medical treatment, evacuations, and notifications of local emergency response agencies and the public. The facility's emergency response equipment is regularly inspected and serviced to ensure it  operates properly.  In addition, the plan is promptly undated to reflect any pertinent changes taking place within Katy Addicks Surface Water Pump Plant's processes that would require a modified emergency response.
